meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by vibration.
meanings.sent1: The vibrionic sound of the guitar strings filled the room.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake caused a vibrionic sensation throughout the building.
meanings.sent3: The vibrionic dance moves of the robot entertained the audience.
meanings.sent4: The vibrionic energy in the air was palpable during the concert.
meanings.sent5: The vibrionic colors of the fireworks lit up the night sky.

meanings.definition: A bacterium of the genus Vibrio.
meanings.sent1: Scientists studied the vibrionic under a microscope.
meanings.sent2: The doctor identified the vibrionic as the cause of the infection.
meanings.sent3: The vibrionic in the petri dish seemed to be having a party.
meanings.sent4: The vibrionic spread quickly through the water, affecting marine life.
meanings.sent5: The vibrionic under the lens looked like tiny squiggly creatures.
